content: >http://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUSTRE52B7HG20090313 The Israel lobby is racking up points in wagging the US doggy. Noting that the Iranians 'so whatted' US sanctions and to-day were shopping for carbon fibre, the Israelis were pleased that Obama wasn't undoing all of GWB's good works. Carbon fibre they claimed to be for manufacturing cars. However it was pointed out that it could be used to manufacture high speed centrifuges, which must be different from the thousands of other centrifuges they're reputed to have imported while GWB was on watch, to make that atomic bomb they're still nowhere near making.
reply: >http://www.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idUSTRE52B7HG20090313 The Israel lobby is racking up points in wagging the US doggy. Carbon fibre they claimed to be for manufacturing cars. However it was pointed out that it could be used to manufacture high speed centrifuges, which must be different from the thousands of other centrifuges they're reputed to have imported while GWB was on watch, to make that atomic bomb they're still nowhere near making.
title: ''At Least Obama's Onside with Iran'': Israelis
